Haven't been here for a while. Every time I say I'm going to post more, I end up ignoring this journal for months. Ah well...I guess LJ has just lost its appeal.

Though I probably should use it more, as I need somewhere to rant.

<lj-cut text="Cue TL;DR">So I started working for Laurent's dad again. Yes, that company that drove me to tears and near mental breakdowns - that very one. And here I am, again, wondering wtf compelled me to come back.

Probably that $3 raise. And the benefits. And some stability. Gamestop was fun and all, but it was not going anywhere. After Christmas they were probably going to get rid of me anyway.

I've been here since mid-December. I thought it would be different - new accounting software, less technicians to run around after, an actual accountant. After a month of being here, I already wanted to quit. But I stuck it out because I needed the money and health insurance.

There comes a time, however, when the money and benefits just don't quite justify staying at a job. Laurent's dad is the same as last time, if not worse. Nothing is ever done right, it seems. And they split the company up for tax reasons. So now instead of doing work for just one, I do work in both, and since the parts manager (well, former manager. He quit, thank god) had no idea what he was doing, I was doing the work of about 3 people. While getting yelled at. Constantly.

But, because I'm incredibly stupid, I stuck it out. Again. I come here every day only to have to fix the owner's fuck ups, placate customers the owner has managed to piss off, and chase after everyone here for them to do their job. I'm not expecting a thanks or some reward. All I'd like is to be talked to like I'm a person and not a toddler. Maybe be able to take a lunch every once in a while (or at least be able to mark that overtime on my payroll...heh, right). Hell, even if I wanted to, I couldn't take a vacation because *no one* else here can do my job.

This is where it gets interesting, however. I've always said that if the service manager, Dave, quits, I'll be gone with him. I literally cannot sit here in the office all day with Jack (Laurent's dad).

Yesterday night, Dave put in his two weeks notice, which completely caught me by surprise. I guess he couldn't take the bullshit either. I don't blame him. I know I said if he left, I'd leave, too, but if I did leave, that would really fuck things up here. They'd lose two employees at once (two that are the only people that can do what they do), and since Jack is here on a visa (through his business, I'm not exactly sure how it works) through his company, he needs to keep a certain number of employees. If I leave, that leaves him one employee short to stay here.

In short: I probably won't quit, as I'm being guilted into staying. If I leave, I'll be the horrible, bitch girlfriend that fucked it all up. Laurent hasn't said anything. In fact, he's actually said he'd understand if I left. I just get this really strong feeling that there would be a lot of resentment if I did. So I'll stay, come home in tears nearly once a week over the sheer stupidity and stress of working here, just so I don't let everyone down.

Still...I think I'm going to look around for other work, just incase I break down and quit...which is likely to happen sometime soon. Even if I take a cut in pay, it'll be worth it.

This? This is why I will NEVER work for family again.</lj-cut>

In other happier news, I finally went and bought myself a new laptop. I put my tax refund, plus a bit more, into a very nice laptop that'll last me a while. And it'll actually run games without lag! I can finally play Sims 3...which I bought 4 months ago and that ended up killing my old laptop. >.>

Plus now I can get Dragon Age and the expansion pack as well. And aaaaaall the DLC I want. :D Was looking at Mass Effect, too, but I'm not too sure I want a shooter, as I suck horribly at them on the 360. Maybe the controls will be easier on the computer.

But, yes, laptop is on its way in today. I am so excited. lol I kinda want to skip the gym today and just mess around with it. :P

I've decided to try and keep this thing updated now, at least for a while. I seem to get really into LJ for a bit, and then I just sort of disappear. Well, not really, as I still come here daily to browse the communities I'm in. I just don't post or keep up with my friends list as much as I'd like to. That and nothing really important has happened that's worth posting about. :P I'm back working for Laurent's dad (again). Yes, I know I'm stupid for going back, but they gave me a raise that was more than double what I was making at Gamestop. Yes, I worked there for a span of about two months before I gave up. Manager was an anal retentive, OCD, perfectionist bastard that treated us like crap (for the most part; he had his good days). I probably should have taken a bigger advantage of my employee discount, but oh well. :P So I quit there and started back at Nauti-Tech near the end of December...and it's just as fun as it was when I quit. Except there are only 4 full time technicians there (down from the 11 or 10 that were working there before I quit). The yachting industry sucks right now, and we're lucky if we can land a few really big jobs now and again (ones over $50,000). Sometimes I feel like quitting again, but I saw what it's like out there, trying to get a job when nothing is available. I might loathe it but at least I'm making a pretty decent income. The only thing that really convinced me to come back was the fact I went from $7.50 per hour to $15.00 per hour...$3.00 more than what I made last time I was there. Plus benefits...yay benefits! Don't have to worry about getting sick anymore. So...yes, hopefully I'll be updating some more. I know I'm going to make an entry about some odd stuff that's happened to me and my family, but I'll do that tomorrow. When it's not dark. And I'm not alone. lol

So the journal is going to stay. I couldn't find a better name, and the one I really wanted was taken...both forms I came up with. Besides, I've had this journal since high school...I can't just delete it.

Instead I've started over completely. Cleaned up a bunch of the communities I was in, removed some friends that were no longer there. Deleted all of the WoW ones first. Now I won't have wow_ladies clogging up my friends page.

Left the game a month ago. I was starting to get too involved in it. Plus there was no way I could raid, and it takes so much time now to do *anything* that it feels like a chore to play it. So I left and I feel SO much better.

I even actually started going to the gym everyday. Up at 8 and there by 8:30, stay for an hour, then come home. It's really refreshing and I have tons more energy. I even lost 10 pounds since I started, so I'm thrilled. :)

Starting school again in the Spring semester. Going to finish up my AA (only three credits left to finish), and from there I'm going to look into cooking/baking classes. I can't decide between going into pastry or becoming a chef. I love both types of cooking, so I'll have to decide at some point.

I'm also starting back up photography again. Nothing really going on with drawing/painting, but I'm hoping that taking photos might help get the creativity flowing again. I should really start using my DA account again...
